fields.description: Currently, only a user with the 'JIRA System Administrators' global permission can manage workflows. We would like a permission to allow users to edit workflows without having to be an admin.
fields.summary: Allow users to manage workflows

fields.description:
h5. Problem
If JMX is enabled during startup, it won't actually expose any of the Jira attributes.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Enable JMX Monitoring in Jira
* Restart
* Connect JConsole
* Check the MBeans for {{com.atlassian.jira}}
* Notice:
!mbeans1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Expected Behaviour
The Jira attributes mentioned here would be shown:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/live-monitoring-using-the-jmx-interface-945111686.html

h5. Actual Behaviour
We see {{com.atlassian.jira}}, but only the datasource within it. None of the Jira attributes are visible.

h5. Workaround
# Disable JMX in Jira and then Re-enable it
# Disconnect JConsole and reconnect
fields.summary: JMX does not share Jira Attributes on Initial Startup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server (with the attachment option enabled), it is found that some attachments are missing. Checking the attachment folder of JIRA Server, it is found that only projects are present. Verifying the attachment folder in the backup file from JIRA Cloud, all the projects are present.

h3. Environment
JIRA Server 7.7.1

h3. Expected Results
All the attachments are completely restored in to the JIRA Server

h3. Actual Results
Attachments are partially restored in to the JIRA Server

h3.Workaround
Manually copy over the attachment folder in to JIRA Server
fields.summary: Attachment folder is not placed in the <JIRA_HOME> after migration of Cloud to Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After migrating data from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server, some issue types are missing their icons. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Server 7.7.1

h3. Expected Results
Issue type icons are displayed properly as displayed on the JIRA Cloud

h3. Actual Results
Issue type icons are missing

h3.Workaround
Have to manually set the icons back
fields.summary: Some issue type icons are missing after migration of data from JIRA Cloud to Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issue Summary and Description that were created from Confluence Product Requirement page  (via !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/427623543/Creat%20JIRA%20Issue.png?version=1&modificationDate=1422394769659&api=v2!  ['Create Jira issue'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/use-jira-applications-and-confluence-together-427623543.html#UseJiraapplicationsandConfluencetogether-CreateissuesfrominsideConfluence] icon) does not actively sync changes between themselves.

As a result, changes or update to the Confluence page must be manually applied to the Jira issues that were linked. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Sync changes between Confluence page and Jira issue that were created via 'Create Jira issue' icon.
fields.summary: Actively sync requirements from Confluence Product Requirement page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a filter is changed and saved, you will see a 'Save as' button to duplicate the filter.  When you modify a saved filter, add a trailing space to the JQL query, run the query, and click on the 'Save' button; the filter is saved but the 'Save' button remains.  You will receive a pop-up that indicates that the filter was saved, but you can no longer duplicate the filter because the 'Save as' button is not displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter
# Open the filter and modify the JQL to add a space to the end of the query
# Run the query
# Click the Save button
# Note that you receive a success message, but the Save button remains
# Remove the space at the end of the query
# Run the query
# Click the Save button
# Note that the 'Save as' button is displayed

h3. Expected Results
The trailing space should either be ignored or the advanced query logic should throw a warning/error blocking the query from running until the space is removed.

h3. Actual Results
The filter is saved with the space, and the Save button doesn't display correctly
fields.summary: Adding space at end of JQL in a saved filter breaks the Save button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Default Java 8 has _Tiered Compilation_, so JDK HotSpot VM users can benefit from improved startup times with the server compiler.
 Compiled JIT code is stored in Code cache and default CodeCache size is equal to 240MB. This is normally enough to middle size application. 
 In case of JIRA with large number of plugins, _size of CodeCache is too small_, that may lead to cache overflow and flush of the cache, which causes significant performance degradation. 
 See related KB: [JIRA crashes due to CodeCache is full|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-crashes-due-to-codecache-is-full-compiler-has-been-disabled-314447083.html]
h3. Suggested Solution

Ship JIRA with larger *CodeCache*: 384m (or 512m)
h3. Workaround

Edit {{bin/setenv.sh}} file and add to {{JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS}}
{code:java}
-XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=384m
{code}
h3. Note on fix

Added the following options:
{code:java}
#
# The following specifies JVM code cache configuration.  High value of reserved size allows JIRA to load more installed apps.
#
JVM_CODE_CACHE_ARGS='-XX:InitialCodeCacheSize=32m -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=512m'
{code}
fields.summary: Ship Jira with bigger ReservedCodeCacheSize by default

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

Our developers would like one overview of all the actions that they need to perform, so one screen that shows all Jira issues in their name, and bitbucket PRs that need their attention.

h2. Suggested Solution

Add a Jira dashboard widget that allows showing the PRs that needs the developer's attention.

h2. Why is this important

This is important because our developers do not have a single overview of all actions that they need to undertake.
fields.summary: Dashboard for Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

By default, exporting a result set of more than 1,000 issues will present the user with a *Forbidden (403)* error. This error is a bit vague and does not provide users with a clear path to resolution.
h3. Suggested Solution

* Include a modified link to the URL that appends the {{&tempMax=1000}} argument. Link text should read as "Download the first 1,000 results". This gets us close to the pre-7.2 export behavior.

* Perhaps provide a link to the relevant kbase on increasing result limits: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/exporting-a-filter-result-containing-more-than-1000-issues-191500982.html

h3. Why this is important
The 403 error is confusing to users, who assume a problem with Jira and raise support requests with their administrators.
fields.summary: Improve 403 Forbidden message when exporting large result sets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the Edit Issue Type form is reloaded after submit due to invalid values, the title and avatar are updated improperly.
h3. Environment

Chrome 64, mac os 10.13
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose an issue type to edit
 # Input a blank name or one exceeding 60 characters
 # Submit

h3. Expected results

The same as initial window (just with the error message)

!Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 10.34.52.png|width=319,height=166!
h3. Actual results

The title is updated to the given invalid name value replacing the original issue type name.

The Issue Type Avatar icon is gone. The image source is broken, with each reload there is a new "/jira" prefix added to the path.

!Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 11.25.55.png|width=537,height=238!
h3. Notes

This happens when the getIconUrlContent() method of EditIssueType class calls the addContextPathToURLIfAbsent() method of URLUtil; the given path throws MalformedURLException and the catch block prepends the contextPath ("/jira").
fields.summary: Invalid labels displayed after reloading the Edit Issue Type form

fields.description:
h3. Definition
In some cases, there are commits that were pushed by mistake and there's no way to undo this action since the commit information are stored as a cache. Clearing the cache will delete all the commit information. 

h3. Suggestion
It would be good to have an option to remove an individual commit information from the UI in case a commit was pushed accidentally.
fields.summary: Have the Possibility of Deleting a Commit on JIRA's end

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Lucene Search with unlimited PageFilter causes unnecessarily memory allocation for enterprise instances (1M+ issues).

In many places unlimited PageFilter is used in JQL queries (Agile board, plugins such as JQL Tricks). This leads to the allocation of an array which has number of documents items, where number of documents is typically greater than number of issues.

For 1M+ issues the object size usually is greater than G1HeapRegionSize/2 so it's humongous object. As part of JRASERVER-63665 there was change to optimize the Lucene search and implement Debug logging. 
bq. Jira prepares a search with a small limit set (1000) first and checks if _totalHits_ is bigger. If it's bigger then we do a second search and we exactly know the limit now (_totalHits_ from the previous search). I also added analytics to validate this limits and also added logs (debug level). 

h3. Expected Results
* Increase log level 
* Fine tune limits. 
* Throw an exception during a search, if someone will try to fetch a large amount of documents (100k+).
fields.summary: Make Lucene Search with unlimited PageFilter fail to prevent unnecessary memory allocation

fields.description:
Hi Team,

As being an administrator for almost an year, we do have requests from users like asking "Admin" privilege for test instance alone. We are authenticating users via LDAP on both production and test instances, so we do not want to create a separate internal account for user and adding them to admin group. Hence we are here landed on the requirement from Jira for the single user permission addition in "Global Permission". 

We could only assign group as part of the "JIRA Permissions". Attached the snap for reference. It would be great if single user addition is enabled for JIRA server. Currently we are using JIRA 7.2.8.

Thanks!

Regards,
Prakash
fields.summary: Single user permission has to be enabled for a Global Permission

fields.description:
When searching for a string in the quick search that contains a "-" for example : 'Project-100-sds' or 'CS201503-25003'

h2. Current behaviour

When adding a string with "-" in the  quick search JIRA immediately assumes the string is an issue key and tries to jump to the issue.

h2. Suggested  behaviour 
The quick search should search for issues keys first and if no results are found.

It should search the text fields with the JQL : text ~ "CS201503-25003"
fields.summary: Quick search should search for issues and text fields when searching with "-"

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Currently, we don't have any information how we can get the Windows integrated Authentification work with MS IIS for JIRA, Confluence, Fisheye, and Crowd. We want to be able to use Windows Login as a Single Sign-On in Atlassian products. 

h3. Suggestion
It would be helpful if we can provide a proper documentation guide on how to perform such integration though it is not supported.
fields.summary: Documentation for Windows Authentication via IIS integration to Atlassian products

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After the migration of data from Jira Cloud to Server, the user is required to generate a new license for any Jira application (such as Service Desk, Jira Core, and/or Jira Software). But they are unable to do so.   Further investigation found that the Server ID in the System Info page is displaying incorrectly in their restored system.  Rather than the proper four groups of four alphanumeric characters (A-Z 0-9), the Server ID appears to be using the old Cloud instance identifier which uses 32 hexadecimal characters (0-9 a-f) to identify the instance.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud (Source instance)
 Jira Server (Destination instance)
h3. Expected Results

Displays the Server ID properly (Example: ABCD-EFGH-IJKL-MNOP )
h3. Actual Results

Displays the Server ID incorrectly  (Example: 12ab3c78-da9d-451f-acab-52f90c9439c0 )
h3. Workaround

You can update the Server ID by following the steps in the KB: [Changing Server ID for Test Installations - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-id-for-test-installations-285839562.html].
fields.summary: Server ID uses the wrong format and is invalid after migrating Jira from Cloud to Server

fields.description:
We`ve noticed a change in text formatting shortcuts. In previous version (i.e. 7.0.4) writing some text inside double curly braces - \{{ }} - results in changed font (monotype) and grey background box. 

 

In current version (7.5.3) only font changes. Is there another shortcut that gives grey box mentioned above?
fields.summary: Text formatting change

fields.description:
Hi,
it would be very helpful if it was possible to group screens and custom fields in the admin view. We're using a fairly small Jira instance (~60 users) and the list of screens and custom fields is already getting out of hand, which makes it hard to quickly find what you're looking for.

At the moment we're working around this issue by trying to keep to a naming convention for all administrative objects like screens, screen schemes, custom fields, field schemes, etc.
This leads to very long and complex names and also doesn't make it any easier to (bulk) change the configuration once our requirements change.

Plug-Ins also often create large numbers of additional screens or fields (eg. XRay Testing Plug-In) and just add to the list.

If it were possible to group these objects and maybe have a few bulk change options available (eg. like renaming parent pages together with child pages in Confluence, where you can add certain prefixes to the page-name) it would make administrating Jira much easier and less error-prone (forgetting fields,...)

Thank you!
Best Regards,
Paul
fields.summary: Ability to group Screens, Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing any issues, go to 'More' then 'Link'. In the 'This issue' field, users are able to select the type of link to create. The problem is when the instance has many of the link types (see attached screenshot), the list of options will be very long. It can be troublesome as most of the link types may not even be related to the project.
!links.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to configure link types available based on projects

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Limit the Link type options available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
Jira link resolves with an Unauthorized error

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Logout from Jira on all browsers on our PC. I recommend closing all browsers.
2. Click on this link: https://jira.netgear.com/secure/Tests.jspa#/report/execution/summary?projectId=10903&reportId=1&option=testPlan&value=631&lastTestResult\\ 

h3. Expected Behavior
Take user to Jira login page to enter credentials.

h3. Actual Behavior
Get an Unauthorized error message

h3. Workaround
Need to login to Jira first on default browser and then click on the link.
fields.summary: Jira link resolves with an Unauthorized error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description
Closed tasks shows incomplete while ending sprint when Last Column in Column Configuration is Resolved.When clicking the "Complete sprint" button it actually says some tasks are still incomplete.

h3. Expected Behavior
Sprint should be completed because tasks are completed according to workflow

h3. Actual Behavior
Click the "Complete sprint" button it actually says that few issue was completed (because Resolved is mapped to last column) and 1 issue as incomplete (because it was in closed status) 

h3. Workaround
Map Closed status also to last Column along with Resolved.
fields.summary: Closed tasks incomplete in Sprint when Last Column in Column Configuration is Resolved

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira is being used in global companies, which have offices around the globe. Jira can be deployed only in single datacenter, which means users will have large RTT to Jira from another locations.
 A couple of examples of network latency:
 * Amsterdam (Ams) - New York (NY): 70 ms
 * Ams - San Francisco (SF): 150 ms
 * Bangalore (BGL) - Ams: 200 ms
 * BGL - NY: 290 ms
 * BGL - SF: 240ms

Pages can have a lot of related html resources (css, png, js), so due to large RTT total page loading time can be very high. 
 Currently due to a lot of context specific JS resources, Jira doesn't support caching at proxy level. So that also means it's not possible to use CDN providers (like Akamai , Cloudflare, AWS CloudFront) to optimise access to application, which is typical solutions to the latency problem.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Enable caching for some of static or semi-static resources: _CSS_, _PNG_, _JS_.
 * Provide documentation which URLs can be cached and which headers should be respected to prevent caching of user specific or sensitive data

h3. Workaround

There are some examples at Community page, you may want to check if those work for you - [CDN-CloudFront-and-Atlassian-Server-apps|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-discussions/CDN-CloudFront-and-Atlassian-Server-apps/m-p/731230]

h3. Resolution
Starting Jira 8.3, Jira Data Center supports CDN. More details can be found at [Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/content-delivery-network-cdn-for-jira-data-center-972329251.html]
After enabling CDN, resources under "/s/..." url will be server from CDN server and not from Jira directly. 

Example:
* While loading data from https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/PSR-383 (main Jira)
* Jira will return links to to load static data from CDN - https://d2mzx5lfbkaqz9.cloudfront.net/s/.../download/contextbatch/css/_super/batch.css
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I want to be able to deploy Jira behind CDN

fields.description:
h3.Symptoms

When on a version of JIRA Service older than the current the application screen show a button with "Update Service Desk".

h3. How to reproduce

# Install JIRA Service Desk lower that the current
# Go to ⚙ > Applications > Version & Licenses > Click on update service desk

h3.Diagnosis

# When clicked without checking the current JIRA Core version and installs the latest version of Service Desk after which Service Desk no longer functions as it is incompatible with the JIRA Core version currently installed.

h3.How to resolve

# Upgrade JIRA Core to compatible the version
fields.summary: Application page suggests Service Desk upgrade that breaks Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If JIRA has Gravatar access enabled but doesn't have internet access, avatar images will get broken and user names overlap.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure JIRA doesn't have internet access and JIRA has Gravatar enabled
# Turn off Gravatar (General Configuration Page)

h3. Expected Results
Avatar images wouldn't get broken and names wouldn't overlap.

h3. Actual Results
* Actual avatar images are broken
* names overlap on the pages

h3.Workaround
Turning off Gravatar would revert to default JIRA icons (but it would still make Gravatar unusable).

h3. Note
- reproducible on JIRA 7.5.2 and 7.6.1
- reproducible in Chrome, Firefox and Internet Explorer 11
- images should be rendered in a different way after they get broken (either set default images or display some kind of message instead of broken avatar image)
fields.summary: Avatars broken and text overlapping on Gravatar-enabled JIRA instance without internet access

fields.description:
While JIRA adds the attribute {{rel="nofollow"}} to links in descriptions or comments it does not on Web Links.

Web Links should also have {{rel="nofollow"}} to prevent browsers sending a {{Referrer}} header revealing the JIRA URL on the target server. Revealing JIRA URLs can be a security risk by revealing a companies private servers or even information when part of the URL string.
fields.summary: Bug: rel=nofollow missing on Web Links

fields.description:
Please upgrade the plugins to be compatible with JIRA 7.7.X as this is been used by Multiple customers and stopping them from upgrading JIRA.
Requested plugin :
# [Jira AutoLink Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-autolink-plugin/server/overview/]
# [SSL for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.jirasslplugin/server/overview/]

Note : If possible include [Jira AutoLink Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-autolink-plugin/server/overview/] as default bundeled plugin.
fields.summary: Make Plugin By Atlassian Labs Compatible for JIRA Version 7.7.x

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some mail servers add single quotation mark around the email address. 
When the catch email address has quotation marks, Jira cannot process it.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set a catch email address info@company.com
# Send a mail to 'info@company.com'

h3. Results
Jira doesn't process the message, and gave an error on incoming-mail-log:
"Cannot handle message as the recipient(s) do not match the catch email"

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve JIRA mail handler so it parses mail without single quotes around the mail address.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't handle incoming emails with single quote marks in Catch email address

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The current behaviour is [JRASERVER-9367|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9367] - when the JQL search does not fit into the custom field scope, the UI will show the custom field on the Issue Navigator with '!' and the user will not be able to choose the field.

This creates a big usability issue for end users in a complex JIRA environment where customfields are configured with very specific project/issue-type contexts, because end users are often not going to know or remember what specific project or issue type combination is applicable to the custom field they are trying to use in the issue navigator.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the user to choose the custom field and then return the result based on the custom field scope.
or 
show the custom field's context when the user hovers over the on the custom field at Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Customfield context restrictions impacts usability of customfield based search in issue navigator - should return the applicable result set even when JQL search isn't restricted to customfield context

fields.description:
Hi,


Creating this for a vendor:

{quote}

Hi Team!
My name's Vadim Rutkevich and I'm a product owner of Smart Attachments app for Jira.
Recently, we have received a request from our customer who wants to clone issues or move issues between projects. This customer is also using our app to distribute attachments across categories.
And as it happens, this customer clones issues or moves them between projects (including attachments). And the mapping to categories should be preserved.
We have reviewed your issue cloning mechanism and it does not fire an event that all attachments were copied from the original issue. This is a problem for us.
Is there any way to get an event that all attachments were cloned from the source issue and now they are available in the cloned issue. So our app can apply all the necessary mappings.
Any recommendations or hints about this will be greatly appreciated.
Thanks.

Best Regards,
Vadim Rutkevich

{quote}

 

Supporting ticket: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-923]

 

Cheers,

Anne Calantog
fields.summary: Improve the way of cloning/moving issues and fire an event when all attachments are copied

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

When we add a special character like '&' in the database password, JIRA will not shown any errors in the log but redirected to the Setup Wizard page and logs doesn't tell anything.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Modify database password in the dbconfig.xml to the following:
{code}
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>mssql</database-type>
  <schema-name>dbo</schema-name>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:sqlserver://xxxxx:1433;databaseName=jiradb</url>
    <driver-class>com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver</driver-class>
    <username>jiradb</username>
    <password>ASDASDASD&ASDASDASD</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>

    <validation-query>select 1</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>

    <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>

  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}
# Startup JIRA and get redirected to the Setup Wizard page.
# When we ran 'config.sh' file then only we see the problem:
{code}
Reading database configuration from /home/ubuntu/deployments/jira/jira-home/dbconfig.xml
IO Exception occurred while trying to load settings.
Unable to load database configuration: org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 10 of document  : The reference to entity "ASDASDASD" must end with the ';' delimiter. Nested exception: The reference to entity "ASDASDASD" must end with the ';' delimiter.
Exception in thread "main" java.awt.HeadlessException:
No X11 DISPLAY variable was set, but this program performed an operation which requires it.
	at java.awt.GraphicsEnvironment.checkHeadless(GraphicsEnvironment.java:204)
	at java.awt.Window.<init>(Window.java:536)
	at java.awt.Frame.<init>(Frame.java:420)
	at java.awt.Frame.<init>(Frame.java:385)
	at javax.swing.SwingUtilities$SharedOwnerFrame.<init>(SwingUtilities.java:1758)
	at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.getSharedOwnerFrame(SwingUtilities.java:1833)
	at javax.swing.JOptionPane.getRootFrame(JOptionPane.java:1696)
	at javax.swing.JOptionPane.showOptionDialog(JOptionPane.java:863)
	at javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(JOptionPane.java:666)
	at javax.swing.JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(JOptionPane.java:637)
	at com.atlassian.jira.configurator.Configurator.showErrorDialogAndExit(Configurator.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.configurator.Configurator.loadCurrentSettings(Configurator.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.jira.configurator.Configurator.main(Configurator.java:30)
{code} 

h3. Expected Results.

JIRA should have prompt an error message about the special characters in the logs or bypass the error to allow special characters in the database password.

h3. Actual Results.

Does nothing until user ran config.sh 

h3. Notes

Is reproducible when connecting JIRA with SQL Server 2014

h3. Workaround

Change the password to without special characters

Either the Attachment Comments need to be displayed differently - ie seperately to regular comments
or
a URL to the actual attachment should be added to the comment.


-Nick
fields.summary: Display attachment comments associated with their attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user doesn't exist and you use a rest call like {{/rest/api/2/search?jql=assignee  was admin}}, then Jira will return 400 Bad Request error rather than a warning that the user doesn't exist. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a {{TestUser}}
# Create an issue, and assign it to {{TestUser}}
# Assign the issue to another user, or unassign it
# Delete the {{TestUser}} account
# Execute the following REST call (since it's a GET, you can browse to it directly):
{code}
$jira-url/rest/api/2/search?jql=assignee%20was%20testuser
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The REST API should return a {{200 OK}} response, with the warning message that the user does not exist. This is the behaviour when the query is {{assignee = testuser}} for example.

h3. Actual Results
The REST API returns a {{400 Bad Request}} response, with the warning message that the user does not exists.

h3. Workaround
Performing a {{POST}} with the JQL as JSON data should return the results correctly. For example:
{code}
curl -X "POST" "http://localhost:47121/j7121/rest/api/2/search" \
     -u 'username:password' \
     -d $'{"jql": "assignee was testuser"}'
{code}
 
h3. Notes
We notice the same issue in the UI too, where '=' is a warning and 'was' is an error
 !equal.png|thumbnail!  !was.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using "'assignee WAS" in JQL for Search REST API gives bad request when user doesn't exists

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, for large JIRA instance, it's recommended for JIRA Administrators to increase the heap size to ensure that the XML backup is completed.

This could be troublesome since the JIRA Administrator has to ensure that the server which is hosting JIRA have enough free physical memory before increasing the heap memory.

The memory utilisation can be high likely because JIRA tries to write the entire data from database to the memory while saving it to the XML file. The behaviour can be observed while opening the entities.xml or activeobjects,xml with text editor like Sublime.


h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the XML backup feature possibly by splitting the files into multiple parts and join then as final step of the XML backup.


h3. Workaround 

Increase the heap size to what suggested [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/JIRA+Sizing+Guide] and generate XML backup.
fields.summary: Improve XML backup feature in large instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Wiki renderer limitation does not allow PDF preview like how it is in the attachment field. The renderer will only allow to create hyperlink of the PDF, hence upon clicking, will redirect to a page solely for the PDF (rather than have a pop-up of the PDF). The reasoning is to create a custom field using wiki renderer that will allow users to click on the attached PDF to preview it making it easier to bring certain files to attention rather than users having to go through all the list of files in the attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the Wiki renderer to include the support of PDF preview.

h3. Workaround 
Use the "Open" button in Internet Explorer. However, there is a bug relating to this: [JRASERVER-44913|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44913].

The Header "X-Download-Options: noopen" should be prevented from setting when document stored in JIRA is clicked.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/no-open-button-in-internet-explorer-when-clicking-on-attachments-311920262.html
fields.summary: PDF Attachment Preview in Wiki Fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current we will face the Chrome error when the browser hits the maximum size of local storage which is 10MB, the related bug tickets are:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-466
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31907
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32634

The KB article that documented this behaviour is [Functionality in JIRA and Confluence fail due to Exceeding Chrome Quota - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/functionality-in-jira-and-confluence-fail-due-to-exceeding-chrome-quota-762874705.html]. There is no way we can increase the local storage size and if we have few subdomains, there are possibilities to hit into this error.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a checker in JIRA to check the health of the local storage of the web browser - if the available size is too low, prompt the user to clear the local storage for the domain from JIRA itself.

h3. Workaround
Based on the comment from a third party vendor, it seems like there is a plugin that has checker and warns the user - for more information, please refer to Przemyslaw's comment in [Atlassian community thread|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Uncaught-QuotaExceededError-Failed-to-execute-setItem-on-Storage/qaq-p/633820].
fields.summary: A feature to handle full local storage of the web browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are not suggested correctly when mentioning users whose names contain Japanese/Chinese characters.
 There are some types of scenario. Please see bellows.
h3. Environment
 * Firefox : Please see *Scenario 1*
 * Chrome, IE : Please see *Scenario 2*

h3. Steps to Reproduce

If you're not familiar with Japanese IME, please see *Notes* section.
h4. Pre-requirements

Please create the following users.
||Username||Full Name||
|aaa|aaa|
|bbb|bbb|
|ccc|ccc|
|ddd|ddd|
|eee|eee|
|zzz|亜亜亜|
{panel:title=Scenario 1 (Firefox)}
 # Go to an issue page and open the comment editor
 # Select Japanse IME
 # Type "@亜"
 # *The user "亜亜亜" is not suggested*
 # Keep typing until the string become "@亜亜"
 # Now, the user "亜亜亜" is suggested{panel}
{panel:title=Scenario 2 (Chrome)}
 # Go to an issue page and open the comment editor
 # Type "@亜"
 # The user "亜亜亜" is suggested
 # Remove all the text in the editor
 # Re-type "@亜"
 # *Now, the user "亜亜亜" is not suggested*{panel}
h3. Expected Results

Suggestions of users whose names contain Japanese/Chinese characters should be shown as English ones are.
h3. Actual Results

As described in the above, users which contain Japanese/Chinese characters are not suggested in some scenarios.
h3. Notes

When typing Japanese/Chinese characters, we need to use Japanese IME.
 Japanese IME works as follows.
{panel:title=What is IME?}
If you would like to type "亜",
 # Select Japanese IME
 # Type a character "a" ("a" is the pronunciation of "亜")
 # Press {{Space}} key
 # Select "亜" from the candidates of Japanese/Chinese characters whose pronunciation is "a"
 # Press {{Enter}} key
 # Now, the character "a" is converted to "亜"

Please see [^ime.mov] for the detail.
{panel}
h3. Workaround
h4. Scenario 1 (Firefox)

Please type more than 2 Japanese characters when mentioning users.
h4. Scenario 2 (Chrome, IE)

Please reload your browser and try to mention the user again.
fields.summary: Users are not suggested correctly when mentioning users whose names contain Japanese/Chinese characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Fields do not appear in auto complete when using advanced search in Issue Navigator.  While the root cause is unknown in every case we have been unable to determine a specific user action that would cause this ( audit log, access log, updating custom field seach key manually, deleting fields, etc ) and the common theme seems to be after upgrades or plugin updates.
Inspecting the custom field reveals something is wrong only when looking at the custom field search key ( see [Adding searching to a custom field|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/custom-field/#adding-searching-to-a-custom-field] ) which is set to None

h3. Expected Results
Jira never modifies a custom field search key in this manner under any circumstance

h3. Actual Results
We have observed the _customfieldsearcherkey_ column in the {{customfield}} table to be NULL
{noformat}
select customfieldtypekey,customfieldsearcherkey,cfname from customfield;
                         customfieldtypekey                  |                          customfieldsearcherkey                |   cfname
-------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------+--------------
 com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link                     | com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link-searcher               | Epic Link
 com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textsearcher | text2
 com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield |                                                                | text1
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This has occurred often enough for our support team to create the following KB article:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/fields-missing-from-jql-auto-complete-due-to-missing-customfieldsearcherkey-859439951.html

A quick search of affected support tickets reveals this happening only after Jira 7

h3.Workaround
Set the custom field search key from None to the correct value ( there's typically only one value to choose other than none )

h3. Summary
When using the Rich Text Editor Visual mode, editing block of text into a format (e.g.: Code), it will add an extra newline. Additionally, when switching between Visual and Text Mode, it will add more newlines.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.3.3, JIRA 7.7.0

h3 Steps To Reproduce
* Press C to create a new issue
* Use the visual editor and enter four lines of text into the Description field (press RETURN after every line)
* now mark lines two and three and format them as code (using the "+" toolbar dropdown)
* You already see an undesired newline between line 2 and 3 in the code block now
* Switch between visual mode and text mode of the editor and you will see another extraneous newline between line 1 and the codeblock

It will be formatted with the same number of lines as before. No unwanted additional lines added after formatting.

h3. Actual Results
Unwanted newlines are added into the text block

h3.Workaround
Create edits in Text Mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Beginning with Jira 7.6.0 a new feature was introduced to allow for the re-arrangement of subtasks on a parent issue.  See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24547 and https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/jira-core-7-6-x-release-notes-938027190.html#JIRACore7.6.xreleasenotes-other for details.

It is possible to disable the dragging of subtask through the use of a dark feature.  
 # Login to Jira as an administrator
 # Navigate to $JIRAbaseURL /secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
 # add the value of  *com.atlassian.jira.issuetable.draggable.disabled* to the enable dark feature and click Add

However this will prevent the dragging of these subtasks both on the issue details page and through the issue navigator. BUT in the issue details view you will still see the up and down arrows that can be used to rearrange the order of these subtasks.

It appears that when using this specific dark feature to disable that draggable feature, the system is still imposing the up / down arrows on that page.   Even though there exists another feature flag by the key of *com.atlassian.jira.issuetable.move.links.hidden* It appears that both disabling the dragging and hiding those icons can not be implemented at the same time within Jira.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Ultimately, we need a way to disable this feature in Jira.  Possible solutions are to change the way the first feature flag works to completely disable the ability to change subtask order.  Alternative to that would be to create a 3rd feature flag that accomplishes the same.

h3. Why this is important
The problem with this is that since previous versions of Jira never allowed for this, some administrators actually created dependencies in regards to the number of subtasks an issue has and the sequence in which they appear on that issue.   As such it is important to those Jira admins to maintain the old functionality that prevented end users from being able to change the order of these subtasks.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator you should be able to completely disable the Drag and drop subtasks feature

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an issue has a lot of work logs on it, it becomes very difficult to quickly see the most recent work logs registered to that issue. The same happens for the comments on an issue, however the comments have a configurable option in the advanced Jira settings to allow you to set the number of minimum comments before Jira will collapse those comments. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-comment-auto-collapse-in-jira-432800920.html] for details on how that can be configured.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if there was another advanced setting parameter that could be defined in the jira-config.properties file in order to control when to collapse work logs. The example name would be something like

*jira.worklog.collapsing.minimum.hidden = 5*

Where the value is number of comments that must exist before collapsing occurs
h3. Why this is important

Same reason it happens for comments: too much data on the page for an initial view is not always helpful
fields.summary: Work log tab on issue details view should be collapsible
Agile boards may be up to 50% slower on boards with 100+ epics.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

The URL that is suggested for use in JIRA Data Center behind a load balancer, as mentioned in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/JIRA+Data+Center+Load+Balancer+examples] states to use {{/status}} and it will return {{"state":"RUNNING"}} for a healthy node that should be in the pool. It is assumed in the documentation that customers have access to their load balancer to add/remove nodes from a pool. In cases where they do not have trivial access, the process for performing maintenance on 1 to n-1 nodes in a Data Center cluster can be expensive, both in terms of time and staff cost.

A suggested workaround has been to use a reverse proxy in front of each node such that the application team could drain connections by using a graceful shutdown of the proxy. This solution is _reasonable_ but not always _feasible_, especially in cases when, for example, the use of Apache or other web servers is not permitted within the governance framework of a customer.
h2. Suggested Solution

Add functionality to the cluster node section of the System info page (or even better, provide a cluster management interface!) to allow administrators to set a node to maintenance mode, effectively taking it out of the pool and draining connections, similar to how a foreground reindex behaves, but without the reindex. This will allow customers to perform tasks such as instance stop/start, thread/heap dumps, support investigations with a live instance, etc.
fields.summary: Allow health check status to be set per-node

h3. Summary

On the latest versions of Jira, the "Hide external user directory" option on the Audit Log Settings is not working anymore.

h3. Environment

Tested on Jira 7.5, 7.6 and 7.7 versions, with different databases and environments.

h3. How to reproduce

Having one external directory configured on your application, on the Audit Log Settings page, select the option to "Hide external user directory" logs from the Audit Log view. It doesn't matter if this options is selected, it is currently always showing the external user directories logs, filling too much of space on the customer's environment.

The option on the database are functioning correctly as checked using the following queries:

{code}select * from propertyentry where property_key like 'jira.option.auditing.log.hide.external.directories'{code}
{code}select * from propertynumber where id = xxxxx{code}

h3. What to expect

It should hide the external user directories when having this option selected.

h3. Workaround

Currently no workaround for the time being.
fields.summary: Audit log not hiding external directory events

h3. Summary

When a user wants to add or select more projects on a "Configuration scheme context" screen a "control" key usage is required to avoid current configuration reset (already selected projects). In case of more than hundred projects on a list, any mistake makes that more painful.
From a user perspective, there's a big risk of unintentional mistake and configuration data loss.
h3. Steps to reproduce

How to get to the screen:
 * Navigate to the Custom Fields page, locate the desired custom field and choose:
 ** cog icon > Configure
 ** locate desired context > Configure
 *** go to page section: Choose the applicable context

The selection process of context (projects) is nasty, a horrible user experience. See screenshot below.
h3. !image-2018-01-31-18-36-14-794.png|width=615,height=148!
h3. Expected results

The more user-friendly solution for a project list that may contain> 500 entries.

User comments:
{quote}I would like to have separate list projects with already subscribed to this setting of options and with "delete" button near every project name.
 Plus separate list of all projects with button "add" or "append" which would add project to the previous list. There could be many potential solutions for this problem. We have 500 projects now, it's really hard to manage scheme/context.
 Or at least change this old multi-select style (ctrl button required) to modern multi-select with autocomplete feature, something like for fields: Labels, Fix Versions etc.
{quote}

h3. Summary

Uploading (pasting) an image (screenshot) from the clipboard cancels the inline edit on board (backlog).
h3. Environment

At least Mac OS X High Sierra on recent Chrome and Firefox.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to board (backlog)
 # Click on the issue to open details view on the right pane.
 # Enter inline edit of description.
 # Paste the image from clipboard.

h3. Expected Results

Inline edit is not closed, i.e. it's still active and focused after adding an image. Moreover, the image is added into description.
h3. Actual Results

Inline edit is cancelled, i.e. image is uploaded and attached to the issue, but any new content is lost, and the image is not added into description too.
h3. Workaround

It's possible to save the content first and add the image later, or using another approach.
fields.summary: Image pasted in Text mode triggers cancelling the inline edit on board / backlog

h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary)

h3. +Concern+

It's not well documented in the below documentations how many nodes are recommended for JIRA Data Center. Customers are not aware of the maximum number of nodes that can be safely implemented:
* [Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-472219731.html]
* [Installing JIRA Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html]

h3. +Suggestion+

Please mention the below page in the above 2 documentations:
* [Scaling Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/scaling-jira-data-center-939699677.html]

(+) This page suggests having up to 4 nodes for JIRA Data Center, and the nodes should be vertically upgraded (upgrading the node resources) rather than horizontally upgraded (adding more nodes of the same resources), where necessary.

fields.description:
So when viewing a project backlog we plan out a quarter's worth of sprints at a time. We do one week sprints and do a sort of rolling quarter, meaning we always have at least 13 sprints created and ready to be planned.

The trouble we run into is by default it seems that all sprints are expanded making scrolling fairly difficult and drag and drop functionality also becomes tricky. But if we go through and collapse each sprint, it becomes much easier.

So if a expand/collapse all sprints in the backlog view was there, it would greatly ease a lot of the pain. 

This applies to Jira software and Jira service desk boards as well.
fields.summary: Backlog - expand/collapse all sprints

fields.description:
In a recent version update to Jira a 'Split Issue' button was added. This button is very helpful but it's currently only visible on the backlog screen. In a perfect world, you realize that you need to split an issue into more issues during planning, but I find that often happens while it is in the active sprint.

Another recent update added the create linked issue to the native actions of Jira service desk. We use a board with some custom filters (our customer request types) for managing our service desk. If that create linked issue button was in the context menu when right clicking an issue in a sprint it would help our workflows greatly.

In short, on every board screen (backlog and active sprints mainly) the context menu when right clicking a sprint should contain the split issue and create linked issue buttons (ideally they would also both be in the issues more actions button as well) for each Jira application project type (core, software, or service desk) to make it easier to use them whenever they're needed.

For example I'm usually looking at the active sprint screen all day long. When I'm working on an issue and run into a bug, I want to be able to right click and make a linked issue so I can add my bug separately in a quick linked fashion. I don't want to hit create and have to remember the key of the issue I'm working on and all the other details. And sometimes I'm working on an issue and realize that the scope of it should really be split up to be managed better, I don't want to have to go over to the backlog, filter through the versions and epics to what I'm working on, and then split the issue. I want to just right click where I'm working and split the issue and create and place the new ones accordingly.

I love that these buttons exist at all, they were a great addition! I would just appreciate it if they were accessible in more places.
fields.summary: Make buttons for create linked issue & split issue available in all board screens for all jira applications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Method {{DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getUniqueFieldLayouts}} might allocate a lot memory during execution while collecting required data, that generates high memory pressure to JVM on large JIRA instances. This might lead to expensive GC and/or OOM events. 

h3. Environment
Large JIRA instance 
* 1k+ CustomFields  
* 100 Field Configurations 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Trigger the call to {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager#getUniqueFieldLayouts}}
#* Note that this method is frequently used in many JQL checks as part of {{DefaultFieldManager.isFieldHidden}} or {{FieldClausePermissionChecker.hasPermissionToUseClause}}

h3. Expected Results
Method will allocate small amount of memory (up to 10MB) or no memory. 

h3. Actual Results
Method allocated 100+MB of memory
 
h3. Notes
* Memory size by *uniqueLayouts* is driven by 2 factors:
** Size of the list - can be large due the large project list using *Field Configurations*
** Size of the element -  _FieldLayoutImpl_ , eg, in this specific case memory size of _FieldLayoutImpl_ is 4.5MB 
{noformat}
Object / Stack Frame                                                                       |Name| Shallow Heap | Retained Heap |
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
key com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.FieldLayoutImpl @ 0x6254a9cb0             |    |           48 |     4,485,552 |
|- <class> class com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.FieldLayoutImpl @ 0x3d09315c8|    |            0 |             0 |
|- id java.lang.Long @ 0x5729c4df0  17935                                                  |    |           24 |            24 |
|- description java.lang.String @ 0x623eeab20  GreenHopper Scrum Story Field Configuration |    |           24 |           128 |
|- name java.lang.String @ 0x623eeabf0  ProjectA Story Field Configuration           |    |           24 |           120 |
|- genericValue org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue @ 0x623eeac68                           |    |           56 |           672 |
|- fieldLayoutItemByFieldId java.util.HashMap @ 0x62d9b9220                                |    |           48 |       160,960 |
|- fieldLayoutItems java.util.ArrayList @ 0x62ebe0970                                      |    |           24 |        16,056 |
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{noformat}
** mostly contributed by *CustomFields*  (through _fieldLayoutItem_)
* Problem get more amplified during cache flush events, eg: JRASERVER-64908, JRASERVER-61166

h3.Workaround
* Reduce number of *Field Configurations* by deleting unused and reusing existing for another project. 
* Reduce number of *CustomFields*, this will reduce memory footprint for _FieldLayoutImpl_ and also will have other improvements
fields.summary: DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getUniqueFieldLayouts generates high memory pressure on large JIRA instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Investigating index corruption we suspect caused by https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61099 it was discovered the portalpage and searchrequest indexes are not replicated properly after a node finishes a re-index

h3. Environment
* Jira Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA DC with 2 nodes, add some issues, some shared dashboards, some issue filters
# Shut down node 2 and remove all contents under portalpage and searchrequest in /caches/indexes/entities ( to simulate https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61099 )
# Startup node 2
# Notice that searching for issues on node 2 works but searching for dashboards or filters does not, no results
# Perform a reindex on node 1 
{code}
018-01-08 17:11:40,609 IssueIndexer:thread-3 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.r.v2.index.ReindexResource] Re-indexing is 99% complete. Current index: Issue
2018-01-08 17:11:43,029 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup started. Requesting node: node1
2018-01-08 17:11:49,438 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup complete. Snapshot file: IndexSnapshot_10101.zip
2018-01-08 17:11:49,444 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.r.v2.index.ReindexResource] Re-indexing is 99% complete. Current index: SearchRequest
2018-01-08 17:11:49,451 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.r.v2.index.ReindexResource] Re-indexing is 99% complete. Current index: PortalPage
2018-01-08 17:11:49,455 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.r.v2.index.ReindexResource] Re-indexing is 100% complete. Current index: PortalPage
2018-01-08 17:11:49,455 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 INFO admin 1030x83x1 1jzv5oa 10.255.2.1 /rest/api/2/reindex [c.a.j.r.v2.index.ReindexResource] Re-indexing finished
{code}
** You'll see node 2 consume this index snapshot in its logs. Try searching for dashboards or filters again on node 2, still nothing
# On node 2, perform an index copy from node 1
** You should see dashboards and filters in search results once more
** However, files are still missing in the directories

h3. Expected Results
portalpage and searchrequest indexes are copied to the filesystem after restoring an index snapshot generated after a re-index

h3. Actual Results
portalpage and searchrequest indexes are only copied during a index copy and even then the files themselves are missing
 

h3.Workaround
* Perform an index copy to immediately restore portalpage and searchrequest indexes
* During the next maintenance window shut down all nodes and copy the portalpage and searchrequest directories from the node that completed a re-index to all other nodes
fields.summary: Index replication after one node's re-index does not restore portalpage or searchrequest indexes
